confession.seduction_context: While upset after dispute over tithe collectors demanding 8 reseaux of wheat when they only had 3. She went to cut heather in Void d'Arches as bedding for animals and met a man in black who promised to aid her against those persecuting her.
powder_types: powder tried on a blind horse
sabbat_activities: transported on a 'ballet' which her master greased

testimony.quarrel_subject: Father had not complied with request to purchase a cotillon at fair for Mengeotte's daughter Didiere, lending her six francs in process

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 15 days after giving birth at Christmas-time

testimony.quarrel_subject: Dispute over cooking bread together - Mengeotte was always complaining, and eventually son told her to do baking elsewhere

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: Same day one of his horses fell ill, and died three days later

witnesses.name: Mengeon Claudon
witnesses.occupation: former Maire of Ban de Vaudicourt

testimony.quarrel_subject: Mengeotte and three daughters came to veillée but others refused to have them and they had to be sent away; Also caught Laussons stealing communal timber 9-10 years earlier

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: A few days after timber dispute

harms_alleged.target: cow belonging to master Claude Matheu

testimony.quarrel_subject: quarrel with both Mengeon and Mengeotte Lausson while setting traps for blackbirds in field

harms_alleged.harm_description: became ill suddenly, but recovered after leaving them

testimony.quarrel_subject: husband 'gaga' (distrained) a horse belonging to Laussons
testimony.threat_quote: que quant on l'avoit fasché elle s'en souvenoit encor de sept ans apres, sans en faire semblant

testimony.quarrel_subject: Dispute over cutting timber - Mengeon tried to cut extra timber for himself
At poisle commun, Mengeotte quarrelled with Bastienne wife of Nicolas de Hadeguey who didn't want her to sit next to her

harms_alleged.target: Bastienne wife of Nicolas de Hadeguey
harms_alleged.harm_description: had a miscarriage and died herself

testimony.threat_quote: par la nom Dieu, elle s'en repentiroit et se donneroit de garde

testimony.quarrel_subject: Quarrel at market of Bruyeres between Laussons and Nicolas Bailliat dit de Hadiguey over humiliation at poisle

harms_alleged.harm_description: slipped on ice, had a miscarriage, and died

testimony.quarrel_subject: Quarrel at poisle in their house involving Bastienne Hadeguey and Bastienne Collignon

witnesses.name: Cleron femme de Mengeon Philippe Baguel

harms_alleged.harm_description: When she was 15 guarding pigs with Mengeotte in woods, after Mengeotte told her not to fall she did so repeatedly; had trouble with legs for long time afterwards
but did not know the cause

testimony.quarrel_subject: quarrelled with mother before her death

harms_alleged.harm_description: Mengeotte came to offer three pears when dying, mother refused; after burial Mengeotte went to grave weekly and prayed to God 'de ne jamais la recepvoir en son Paradis'

testimony.quarrel_subject: owed Laussons money and been unable to repay

harms_alleged.harm_description: Wife was already ill and became worse despite pilgrimages; they lived in Lausson's house for 6 months where wife tried to persuade Mengeotte to cure her, but eventually died

testimony.quarrel_subject: slowness in undertaking sewing job for Mengeotte's daughter

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: immediately after Mengeotte's daughter Didiere took baby to their house
harms_alleged.harm_description: Baby became ill for a year; Mengeotte made pilgrimage to Bel Bernard and child recovered
recovered after being given some rye Mengeotte had brought
After pilgrimage Mengeotte brought 'vin benist' which was given to child for 9 days

harms_alleged.target: her son Jean Loys, paistre du trouppeau des porcs
harms_alleged.harm_description: had fever for 9 months

testimony.quarrel_subject: their son Mengon aged 9 called Lausson daughter 'fille de sorciere' after ox escaped into Lausson meadow

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: A week later became sick, died after 5 weeks

testimony.quarrel_subject: wife's dispute with Mengeotte over baking

harms_alleged.harm_description: ill for 7-8 weeks, cured when Mengeotte's daughters gave her some fruit
they had lost some other animals when living near Laussons, and had finally moved elsewhere
When Mengeotte asked how it was, he said the devil had made it sick. Next day her daughter came to borrow butter and it quickly recovered

testimony.quarrel_subject: wife's skeptical comment about Mengeotte's pilgrimage reported back to her

harms_alleged.harm_description: became as if 'forcenée', had to take her to Monsieur St. Humbert d'Aultrey where she did a neuvaine and recovered

Had been ill a year before, so that he could not eat, sleep, or work. Mengeotte advised him to go make offerings to St. Don and St. Demenge; did so and was cured. Believed himself to have been bewitched, but did not know by whom

witnesses.name: Catherine femme de Colas Jean Bagay

harms_alleged.harm_description: ill for 9 months, had to go on crutches; gradually recovered after Mengeotte advised soup made on Good Friday
Some 24 years back touched by whirlwind in fields and become 'comme demoniacle'; eventually somewhat healed by soup provided by Mengeotte
wife fell gravely ill with ulcers on body; Mengeotte made pilgrimage to Bel Bernard for payment; wife improved but relapsed when Mengeotte's daughters heard it was giving her bad reputation

testimony.quarrel_subject: allowed procureur to defend paistre against Laussons who wanted him to pay for a cow which had died

harms_alleged.harm_description: wife hurt knee with axe in woods (seemed no more than scratch), had terrible pains for two years and finally died

timeline.details: Substitut forwarded case to Procureur General with request for action
Case authorized from Mirecourt, prévôt of Bruyères ordered to act
Prévôt of Bruyères summons witnesses for following Monday and Tuesday, 6 and 7 July

timeline.subject: Mengeotte Lausson
timeline.details: Witness depositions against Mengeotte begin (35 witnesses total over July 6-7)

timeline.subject: Mengeon Lausson
timeline.details: Witness depositions against Mengeon begin

timeline.subject: Mengeon Lausson
timeline.details: Procureur general orders imprisonment and continuation of case

timeline.subject: Mengeotte Lausson
timeline.details: General denial of all charges

timeline.subject: Mengeon Lausson
timeline.details: Resisted hostile questioning, made no serious admissions

timeline.subject: Mengeotte Lausson
timeline.details: At first continued denials, then while waiting in separate room said ready to confess

timeline.subject: Mengeon Lausson
timeline.details: Maintained denials, charged that Pourcel had paid witness to depose against him

timeline.subject: Mengeotte Lausson
timeline.details: Repeated earlier confessions, admitted trying powder on blind horse, recognized woman of Aydoiles and Jean Adam at sabbat (both already executed)

timeline.subject: Mengeotte Lausson
timeline.details: PG des Vosges asks for execution after torture to establish maléfices and accomplices

timeline.subject: Mengeon Lausson
timeline.details: PG des Vosges asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire with appropriate moderation

timeline.subject: Mengeotte Lausson
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves

timeline.subject: Mengeon Lausson
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves

timeline.subject: Mengeotte Lausson
timeline.details: Given thumbscrews and rack, would add nothing to previous confessions, protesting she could not lie when under oath

timeline.subject: Mengeon Lausson
timeline.details: Given thumbscrews on hands and feet, racked, placed on strappado with two stones weighing 40 lbs. Still held firm and denied everything

timeline.subject: Mengeotte Lausson
timeline.details: Sentence carried out

timeline.subject: Mengeon Lausson
timeline.details: PG asks for more witnesses to be produced

timeline.subject: Mengeon Lausson
timeline.details: Prévôt of Bruyères agrees to more witnesses

timeline.subject: Mengeon Lausson
timeline.details: Supplementary informations (12 additional witnesses)

timeline.subject: Mengeon Lausson
timeline.details: Maintained denials of all significant points

timeline.subject: Mengeon Lausson
timeline.details: Yet again denied everything

timeline.subject: Mengeon Lausson
timeline.details: Court members went to tower to experiment with noise

timeline.subject: Mengeon Lausson
timeline.details: PG des Vosges asks for permanent banishment and confiscation of goods

timeline.subject: Mengeon Lausson
timeline.details: Change de Nancy recommends 'renvoyé jusqu'a rappel' (released subject to recall) with admonishment to behave properly

torture.restrictions: question ordinaire et extraordinaire with appropriate moderation (for Mengeon)

accomplices_named.name: la Guengatte
accomplices_named.context: According to witness 17, when being escorted to Bruyeres where she was subsequently executed, she said Mengeotte was as bad as her

accomplices_named.name: woman of Aydoiles
accomplices_named.context: Mengeotte said she recognized her at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: Jean Adam
accomplices_named.context: Mengeotte said she recognized him at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: Toussaince
accomplices_named.context: Mengeotte said if she were burned as a witch, she would denounce her husband's sister Toussaince as one too

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeotte Lausson
notable_quotes.french: que quant on l'avoit fasché elle s'en souvenoit encor de sept ans apres, sans en faire semblant
notable_quotes.english: that when someone angered her she remembered it for seven years afterwards, without showing it

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeotte Lausson
notable_quotes.french: par la nom Dieu, elle s'en repentiroit et se donneroit de garde
notable_quotes.english: by God's name, she would repent and take care
notable_quotes.context: Said outside Bastienne's house after quarrel, witness 11

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeotte Lausson
notable_quotes.french: de ne jamais la recepvoir en son Paradis
notable_quotes.english: to never receive her in Paradise
notable_quotes.context: Prayer at grave of Colas Poirat's mother, witness 18

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeotte Lausson
notable_quotes.french: bien aisé que son marit estoit ainsy qu'elle, qu'aultrement ses soeurs le feroient depationner
notable_quotes.english: very glad that her husband was like her, otherwise his sisters would make him suffer

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeotte Lausson
notable_quotes.french: elle l'aymoit comme un des siens
notable_quotes.english: she loved him like one of her own
notable_quotes.context: Said of Jean Louys, son of Dieudonné Jean Martin, during interrogation

notable_quotes.speaker: Poirat Prestemol to Mengeon Lausson
notable_quotes.french: qu'il estoit un fascheux homme, et que pour estre cognu, quel il estoit, il ne failloit si fort faire le mauvais
notable_quotes.english: that he was a troublesome man, and that to be known for what he was, he should not act so badly

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeon Lausson (imprisoned)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il luy faisoit tousiours la guerre, et que tous luy en vouloient
notable_quotes.english: that he [the Devil] always made war on him, and everyone wanted to harm him
notable_quotes.context: Said to gaoler after noises in tower

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeon Lausson (imprisoned)
notable_quotes.context: Heard by witness during strange noises in prison tower

notable_quotes.speaker: Procureur General des Vosges
notable_quotes.french: odieux de voire tel monstre parmy le peuple, auquel trop cogneu et craint il ne pourroit aporter que sedition
notable_quotes.english: odious to see such a monster among the people, who being too well known and feared could only bring sedition

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeon's sister Libaire (hearsay)
notable_quotes.context: Reported that when Mengeon heard rumors his wife Mengeotte was behaving impudently before marriage, he threw himself desperately into oak woods and returned at night muddy and wasted; also that when distrained for damages over a horse, he became so discomforted he invoked the Evil Spirit to come get him rather than be so tormented

relationships.evidence_text: daughter of Claudon Durant of Amouzey

economic_context.details: Multiple incidents involving timber theft and disputes over communal resources. Witness 19 owed Laussons money and unable to repay. Dispute over tithe collectors demanding 8 reseaux of wheat when Laussons only had 3 in house. Various disputes over property boundaries, animals in fields, and resource sharing (baking, ploughing arrangements).

harms_catalog.harm_description: three-year illness, loss of breast milk after childbirth
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: father had not purchased cotillon at fair for Mengeotte's daughter, lending six francs
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: during Christmas childbirth, 15 days after birth
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft; cured by bread, salt, and ashes from Mengeotte's house made into soup

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute over cooking bread together - son told her to bake elsewhere
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: Same day fell ill, died three days later

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Mengeotte and daughters refused at veillée
harms_catalog.harm_description: recently bought horse became ill just after passing Mengeotte's house

harms_catalog.victim_name: three cows belonging to Mengeon Claudon
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: As Maire, caught them stealing communal timber, they tried to attack him
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: A few days after, three cows died within a week

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: veillée incident
quarrels and menaces
quarrels and menaces

harms_catalog.harm_description: Mengeotte went to grave weekly and prayed to God 'de ne jamais la recepvoir en son Paradis'

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: owed Laussons money, unable to repay, Mengeotte threatened

harms_catalog.harm_description: sick, recovered after being given rye Mengeotte brought

harms_catalog.harm_description: ill for 7-8 weeks, cured when Mengeotte's daughters gave her fruit

harms_catalog.harm_description: when Mengeotte asked how it was, Claude said devil made it sick; next day her daughter borrowed butter and ox quickly recovered

harms_catalog.harm_description: became as if 'forcenée', cured via neuvaine at Monsieur St. Humbert d'Aultrey

harms_catalog.victim_name: Catherine femme de Colas Jean Bagay
harms_catalog.harm_description: ill for 9 months, had to go on crutches; gradually recovered after Mengeotte advised soup made on Good Friday
harms_catalog.method_alleged: cure via soup made on Good Friday and pilgrimages to St. Curien

harms_catalog.victim_name: second wife of Nicolas Antoine Dieudonné
harms_catalog.harm_description: gravely ill with ulcers on body; Mengeotte made pilgrimage to Bel Bernard for payment; wife improved but relapsed when Mengeotte's daughters heard it gave her bad reputation; died
harms_catalog.method_alleged: initial improvement via pilgrimage, then relapse when reputation concerns arose

harms_catalog.harm_description: hurt knee with axe in woods (seemed no more than scratch); had terrible pains for two years and died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: he allowed procureur to defend paistre against Laussons over dead cow

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost two horses
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: refused to pay Mengeon 3 gros after St. Dié market incident, said 'deut il faire mourir tout son bestail, femme et famille'

harms_catalog.harm_description: leg broken when wheel ran over it
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Mengeon as maistre des chetifs asked for 'droict au Marié', when not paid immediately tried to stop horses, carter touched him with whip

harms_catalog.harm_description: killed under his own plough in the fields
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Mengeon threatened him for not having completed payment to one of his daughters who had been in his service

harms_catalog.harm_description: swelling/enflure started on hand Mengeon had pinched, spread to all noble parts including neck, suffocated and died three days later
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Mengeon came to buy cheap meat from sick bull, became angry at price and pinched mother's hand
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: next day became sick, died three days after

harms_catalog.harm_description: died so suddenly couldn't receive sacraments
group of oxen from common herd suddenly rushed at him as if 'en furie et enragés'
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrels over ploughing arrangement - damaged plough, complaints about unequal ploughing
ploughing disputes
as forester of Ban de Vaudicourt, caught Mengeon cutting wood; latter threatened it would cost him 40 francs
gave Mengeon hope to cut hay from meadow but finally unable to do so; Mengeon very angry

harms_catalog.victim_name: sow of Nicolas (Jean Claudel Antoine's testimony)
harms_catalog.harm_description: entered Lausson meix on night of great tempest
killed while ploughing - leading horses became frightened and he was run over trying to restrain them
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Mengeon said if man had not forced him to give 'couvrechef' to his daughter, he would not have died
quarrel at St. Dié over 9 gros; also refused to sell haystack 'a sa fantaisie'

harms_catalog.harm_description: returning from fair at Stoff, horses took fright at castle moat and went wild
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: refused to sell haystack

harms_catalog.victim_name: child of Dieudonné Jean Martin household
harms_catalog.harm_description: arms and legs twisted, might be ill all its life
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Simon Neufville and Demenge Rouyer collected debt and left two 'seriers' as security in Martin's house

harms_catalog.harm_description: became excessively difficult to handle over period of 5 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: refused proposition by Mengeon that they should join horses for ploughing; Mengeon complained around village that witness 'le dedaignoit'
called Mengeon a witch when passing his house

weather_events: great tempest when sow entered Lausson meix
whirlwind in fields that touched husband of Catherine
great wind that nearly blew Pieron Pourcel into etang
economic_hardship_indicators: tithe-collectors demanded 8 reseaux of wheat when Laussons only had 3 in house
Jean Bruyant owed Laussons money and unable to repay
multiple disputes over debts, timber rights, communal resources
religious_calendar_references: various saints' days and pilgrimages (St. Don, St. Demenge, St. Curien, Bel Bernard, St. Genoy, St. Humbert)
coming Christmas (4 years before Jean Richier incident)

prior_legal_disputes.description: Laussons caught stealing communal timber by Mengeon Claudon as Maire of Ban de Vaudicourt 9-10 years earlier; tried to attack him
Laussons wanted to make paistre pay for a cow which had died; Claudon Bailliot allowed procureur to defend paistre
Mengeon 'coustengé' by community for wood he had cut 6 years before
Mengeon 'coustengé' by Mengeon le Maire and others for horse taken in damages
Pieron Pourcel and Mengeon Lausson to law before justice of Ban de Vaudicourt 6 months before trial

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Mengeon held in tower; noises heard; fellow prisoner feared tower would collapse; gaoler delivered food

hearsay_chains.content: suspected Mengeotte of causing death of a cow and sickness of an ox
when escorting la Guengatte to Bruyeres for execution, she said Mengeotte was as bad as her
heard Mengeotte praying at grave 'de ne jamais la recepvoir en son Paradis'
Mengeotte advised going to Bel Bernard and St. Demenge

hearsay_chains.reporter: Nicolas Bailliot dit de Hardeguey (witness 1 against Mengeon)
hearsay_chains.content: Mengeon threatened Jean Sebille who was killed three days later under plough
if her brother were a witch, became so after hearing wife's impudent behavior; threw himself in woods; later invoked Evil Spirit when distrained
quarrel between Claude Matheu and Mengeon over ploughing

emotional_state_notes: Mengeotte: at first continued denials, then while waiting said ready to confess
Mengeotte under torture: protested she could not lie when under oath
Mengeon under torture: held firm, denied everything, said if not 'homme de bien' would not allow himself to be broken
Mengeon: generally denied not only evil-doing but also threats
Mengeon: angry at Mengeon Claudon, said if he had been 'homme de bien' would not have gone to Mirecourt to secure arrest
Mengeon: charged Pourcel paid witness to depose against him
Mengeon: called two teenage witnesses 'petits coquins'
Mengeon imprisoned: shaking his head, said devil 'luy faisoit tousiours la guerre, et que tous luy en vouloient'

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: if Mengeon Claudon had been 'homme de bien' he would not have gone to Mirecourt to secure his arrest
charged that Pourcel had paid Dieudonne Colin 'quelque escot' to depose against him
said two teenagers (witnesses 6 and 7 supplementary) were 'petits coquins' and made up their story

third_parties.name: Antoine Chaxel

third_parties.name: Bastienne wife of Nicolas de Hadeguey
third_parties.context: died after quarrel at poisle with Mengeotte

third_parties.name: Nicolas de Hadeguey (Nicolas Bailliat dit de Hadiguey)
third_parties.context: husband of Bastienne; quarrel at market with Laussons

third_parties.name: Nicolle fille Godoy Mandray
third_parties.context: at poisle, Bastienne Hadeguey told her to move closer to her away from Mengeotte

third_parties.name: Bastienne Collignon

extraction_metadata.notes: This is an exceptionally detailed trial record with 35 witnesses against Mengeotte and 30+ against Mengeon (her husband). Mengeotte confessed and was executed on 19 August 1620. Mengeon withstood torture and maintained denials throughout; remarkably, despite the PG's request for permanent banishment, the Change de Nancy released him subject to recall with admonishment on 28 September 1620. The trial reveals extensive social tensions around the poisle commun (common warming house), economic disputes over resources, and a pattern of alleged harms following quarrels. Notable features include: Mengeotte's pattern of offering cures/pilgrimages to those she allegedly harmed; the economic context of tithe disputes triggering her alleged pact; extensive witness corroboration; supernatural phenomena in prison (voices, noises); and the court's unusual leniency toward Mengeon despite overwhelming testimony.
